result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jerold D Hansen was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1519  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. To be taken from prison funds.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent in writing and functioning IID. Not use or possess alcohol.
Sobrietor for first 6 mo.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Due to def's successful completion of the Earned Release Program on 4/8/16, court ordered DOC to effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order.

DOC notified the court that defn has completed the Wisconsin Drug Abuse Program/Earned Release Program and is requesting the Court authorize the inmate's release and conversion of the remaining confinement time to extended supervision.
filed by defn

Ct ordered zero restitution
payment plan for fines/cost (filed by Atty Cohen)
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-23-2015 01:15 pm
Parties indicate there will be a plea but no agreement at this time.  Atty Cohen asks for case to be set for a plea/sentencing in 30 days.
Atty Cohen and Defendant appeared and advised they did not receive notice for STC on 08-05-2015 nor dates for JS/JT; Defendant and Atty Cohen given notice-in-hand for new dates for STC/JS/JT
Status conference on September 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No appearance by Defendant or Atty Cohen; clerk will contact Atty Cohen to inquire why there were no appearances; case will be left on trial calendar
Leave on trial calendar

Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of not guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued

Deputy Jeffery Thiel, DCSO duly sworn & testified.  Direct exam by ADA Cordona. Cross exam by Atty Cohen.  Re-direct by ADA Cordona.  Exhibits presented.  Exhibit 1 received. State moves for bind over.  Atty Cohen objects to bind over.  Ct. found probable cause & ordered bind over.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
